Description: Fragment of black figure (?) pottery situla (?); straight sided flaring ring foot with faceted lower edge and part of lower body; reconstructed from two joining sherds. Streaky, dull black/brown slip on outside; surface worn. Hard, fine, light orange clay; Munsell 7.5YR 8/4 (pink).
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A, bench on west side
Curator's comments: Findspot number '19A W' scratched twice by Petrie.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 360)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.208)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
